intro: Lasiorrhiza tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
